entries.femaleVariant: The NUSA's Space Force One has been shot down over Dogtown, and with President Rosalind Myers on board!
There it is! Dogtown stadium, symbol and heart of the troubled district, now site of a brutal home-grown cyberpsycho attack! We're talking blood, guts, mayhem and more – I'm sure you get the picture.
Well, they've done it again! Our sources on the other side say there's been more firefighting and mayhem at Dogtown's stadium!
All right, Night City! Let's talk about recent events at the spaceport. And I mean what really happened, corpo rat bullshit notwithstanding.
Well, well, we've got another Dogtown scandal on our hands! Turns out the district was home to an organized crime syndicate dealing in what? How about "the underage sports stars of tomorrow?"
This just in: You got implants? Well, you're fucked! You heard that right, Night City! F-u-c-k-fucked!

We've received disturbing reports about a group of netrunning blackmailers who could hack your chrome! I mean you! Apparently, the group takes over your implants, and if they don't get their ransom... It's sizzle time!

Hellooo, Night City! Hey, how 'bout a little story time fun? Now, once upon a time, before the dark, dark days of the DataKrash, Militech built itself a secret underground city within a city – our city!
That mysterious complex of underground bunkers, dusty storage rooms and murky laboratories was where they forged a cybernetic weapon that could shift the course of history...
Hah, you really believe that fairy tale? A secret military project right under our feet and under Arasaka's nose? Puh-lease!
Just another urban legend, I say. But what if there's a grain of truth to every legend? Well, as always, stay tuned – your man Stan's here with his finger on the city's pulse!
You heard that right! According to eyewitnesses at the scene, a surface-to-air missile struck the president's craft while in Night City airspace.
But who's behind the attack on the NUS president? And why here, why now? All we have is Washington's assurances Myers survived the crash and is safe.
But I gotta ask – where's the rest of the story? Why are Militech, Arasaka and Night Corp holding their tongues? Suspicious much? Yeah, my thoughts exactly!

Dogtown – the district's all over the news these days, isn't it? Now, some people might call Dogtown a grotesque, ad absurdum bastardization of the American Dream – a place where what's possible depends only on how dirty you're willin' to play.
Others see it as a simple pain in the, uh, collective conscience. Once meant to be a bigger, better, flashier Las Vegas, the district is now home only to this old chestnut:
"What happens in Dogtown, stays in Dogtown." And I say, let's keep it that way. For our own safety – and peace of mind.
Apparently, the cyberpsycho was a member of Kurt Hansen's security forces. That's right, a soldier for the self-appointed leader of Dogtown. Color me not surprised!
MaxTac managed to apprehend the cyberpsycho, but if I were you, I'd start giving Dogtown an extra-wide berth.
Now, that would be biz as usual in the district, if it weren't for one itty bitty detail – it seems none other than Kurt Hansen was struck down in the chaos.
So, who will be Dogtown's next warlord-prince? And what does that mean for upstanding Night Citizens such as ourselves? Guess we're about to find out!
A big, fat nothing, that's what! And since Night Corp didn't stand to gain, that means they didn't do it. Easy math for you there, Night City. So, who was it? Now that's where the real story begins!

That's right! Seems they were tradin' kids, most of them poor and underprivileged. The group ran a secret Dogtown clinic where they stuffed the little prodigies with the latest supplements and cyberware meant to boost their athletic performance.
It remains unclear who first blew the whistle on this shocking story. But don't worry! Our reporters are on the case, so stay tuned!
So, have we fallen prey to 'runner terrorists? Or is our own technology getting the better of us? This might be just the beginning – be careful out there, chooms.

Orbital Air blames Night Corp for the attack. Night Corp obviously denies it. And you know what? For some reason, I can't help but believe the NC 'rats! What on earth would they get from striking the spaceport?
Hmm, let's think – who wants Orbital Air and Night Corp distracted and squabbling? Who'd really like to strengthen their claims in Night City, low-Earth orbit and on the Moon, hm?
I'll give you a hint! This program is sponsored by two little letters: M and A. Which one do you put your eddies on? Let me know, dear listeners – I'd love to hear what you think!
